Class Line

  • java.lang.Object
    • Line

  • public class Line
extends java.lang.Object
    The Line class represents a line that can be drawn onto a window.
    Author:
    Edward Min

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static double MARGIN_OF_ERROR 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Line(double x1, double y1, double x2, double y2)
      Initializes a Line from point (x1,y1) to (x2,y2).

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

      Sets up the colors/line widths, then draws this Line using marker.

      Calculates the intersection point of this Line and the Line other.

      Determines whether a point is on this Line

    • Constructor Detail

      • Line

        public Line(double x1,
            double y1,
            double x2,
            double y2)
        Initializes a Line from point (x1,y1) to (x2,y2).
        Parameters:
        x1 - x coordinate of the first point
        y1 - y coordinate of the first point
        x2 - x coordinate of the second point
        y2 - y coordinate of the second point

    • Method Detail

      • draw

        public void draw(processing.core.PApplet marker)
        Sets up the colors/line widths, then draws this Line using marker.
        Parameters:
        marker - PApplet used to draw this Line
        ”Postcondition:”
        marker now has a Line drawn onto it

      • getAngle

        public double getAngle()
        Returns the angle of the Line on the interval -pi/2 to pi/2
        Returns:
        Angle of tilt of this Line

      • getIntersectionX

        public java.lang.String getIntersectionX(Line other)
        Calculates the intersection point of this Line and the Line other. If they do not intersect, it returns "UNDEFINED." If they do, this method returns the point's x coordinate in String format.
        Parameters:
        other - Another Line object
        Returns:
        The x coordinate of their intersection in String format or "UNDEFINED" if they do not intersect

      • getIntersectionY

        public java.lang.String getIntersectionY(Line other)
        Calculates the intersection point of this Line and the Line other. If they do not intersect, it returns "UNDEFINED." If they do, this method returns the point's y coordinate in String format.
        Parameters:
        other - Another Line object
        Returns:
        The y coordinate of their intersection in String format or "UNDEFINED" if they do not intersect

      • getLength

        public double getLength()
        Returns the length of the Line.
        Returns:
        Length of this Line

      • getX1

        public double getX1()
        Returns the x coordinate of the first point.
        Returns:
        x1

      • getX2

        public double getX2()
        Returns the x coordinate of the second point.
        Returns:

      • getY1

        Returns the y coordinate of the first point.
        Returns:
        y1

      • getY2

        Returns the y coordinate of the second point
        Returns:
        y2

      • intersects

        public boolean intersects(Line other)
        Determines whether or not this Line and the Line other intersect.
        Parameters:
        other - Another Line object
        Returns:
        Returns a boolean if this Line and the Line other intersect

      • onTheLine

        public boolean onTheLine(double x,
                         double y)
        Determines whether a point is on this Line
        Parameters:
        x - x coordinate of the point
        y - y coordinate of the point
        Returns:
        If the point (x,y) is on this Line

        public void setPoint1(double x1,

      • setPoint2

        public void setPoint2(double x2,
                      double y2)
        Sets the second point of this Line to (x2,y2).
        Parameters:
        x2 - x coordinate of the new point
        y2 - y coordinate of the new point

      • translate

        public void translate(double x,
                      double y)
        Translates this Line by x units to the right and y units downwards.
        Parameters:
        x - Amount of units shifted to the right
        y - Amount of units shifted downwards
